name: repletion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being full, especially with food: The lion hauled the wildebeest carcass back to its cave and feasted on it to repletion. Despite her feeling of repletion, she couldn't resist the banoffee pie, and forced down a hefty slice.
the state of having a full supply of something that your body needs, or the act of replacing this until there is enough: Electrolyte repletion was necessary in some patients suffering from dehydration. Repletion of serotonin in those previously depleted causes a return to happiness.
More examplesFewer examplesThe room was filled to repletion with a heaving crowd of adoring fans.I found the sense of repletion to be a pleasurable one, and sat back to put my feet up.Therapy consists of rest in a cool place, and repletion with solutions containing salt.
